author: {'steamid': '76561197965820698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1688412926}
review: This is a very traditional point and click adventure game in the style of old Lucasarts games. The developers have stayed very pure to that style of game and haven't gone out of their way to add much in the way of modern quality of life improvements. The game also leans into some of the old obscure puzzle solutions which will have you trying everything with everything (which is extra frustrating when you aren't sure you've actually found everything in the first place). Having said that, if you are OK with that style of game then there is a lot to like here with an interesting graphic style, world building and story. The game shines when it puts you in urban environment, but it's a little underwhelming graphically when you reach The Underland. The writing isn't outright funny but it is amusing and there are enough compelling characters to keep you coming back. Out of the three chapters I'd say 2 is the strongest whilst the 3rd is the weakest. This chapter feels strongest in terms of giving you a lot of story progression and a really nice amount of world to play around in. I really think the background in chapter 2 are the prettiest out of all three chapters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061737345', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1657506840}
review:
[h1]I'm down to journey some more[/h1]
Having played [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/220090/The_Journey_Down_Chapter_One/]part 1[/url] of [i]The Journey Down[/i] saga a number of years ago, playing part 2 was long overdue. Fortunately it seems that all the merits of the first installment have carried over to the second. Since it would be a little redundant for me to review both games with such similar merits, think of this as a review for both the first and second parts of The Journey Down.

[b]M E R I T S[/b] (that's the word I used, and I'm sticking to it)
[list]
[*]The voice acting is superb, and by extension the characters feel more vibrant and interesting. Though some performances are distinctly cheesy, it gives their characters personality and charm.

[*]The music and ambient sound design is quintessentially adventure gamey. There's something so cozy about a simple marimba tune, and The Journey Down isn't shy to give you more than your prescribed dose of marimba.

[*]The story is archetypal in some ways, but the world it's set in certainly intertwines some interesting fantasy elements. The settings largely bear elements reminiscent of the world as we know it, overshadowed by the ominous inevitability of a journey down (ğŸ˜‰) into [i]the mist[/i].

[*]Graphically, the pre-rendered animations and backgrounds are beautifully crafted, as are the cutscenes scattered throughout.
[/list]

[b]The only negative...[/b]

...is that this game is part of an episodic series. Each part runs from around 3-5 hours, giving you a maximum of around 15 hours of gameplay. A point-and-click game of a similar length like [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/215160/The_Book_of_Unwritten_Tales/]The Book of Unwritten Tales[/url], for instance, comes as one, cohesive experience. 

Breaking up the narrative into three seperate parts not only makes the experience more expensive (which I don't have an issue with, since these are quality games) but trissects the narrative, potentially breaking immersion.

This would be more of an issue if the pacing between parts had been worse, but the endings for each part feel relatively satisfying. A definitive edition in one, unbroken game would be ideal.

[b]YOU HAVE COMPLETED THE JOURNEY DOWN THROUGH THIS REVIEW[/b]

Good job, but the game's probably more satisfying than reading this review. You should get this game instead. Or if reviews are just more your thing, you could just go off and read some more reviews. That's cool too.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027748760', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1659416072}
review:
A super charming series with a truly wonderful soundtrack (and a surprisingly metal ending, LOL)! 

Iâ€™d say a must-play for any fan of PnC adventure games. Itâ€™s not the most super-polished game ever, but I can tell a lot of heart went into making this. The music, the overall vibe, and the characters are all so charming. I enjoyed every moment of exploring their world.

None of the puzzles are super-duper head-scratchingly challenging, but all of the solutions make actually logical sense, and I can really appreciate that! 

By the way, if you feel discouraged at all by the somewhat short playtime of the first chapter, donâ€™t worry; I can assure you the subsequent two chapters have twice as much playtime each. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996130731', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1634678705}
review: Turn the lights off, snuggle up under the sheets, and escape into the wonderful world of Journey Down part duex! I'm so glad to be back, soaking in the atmosphere, the environments have their own distinct personalities. After wandering up and down Port Artue, it feels like going home... like Melee Island! The music is fantastic, the puzzles are still logically solvable, and the characters are likeable! One of my favourite point n click adventure games series so far, can't wait to start on Chapter 3! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197960363349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1623465520}
review:
As a genre fan, I can only recommend the Journey Down series.

This series has everything a good and typical point-and-click adventure must have. There are good and fun puzzles, quirky characters, nice humor and a compelling story.

Thanks everyone at SkyGoblin for this game series and the Linux support. Chapter two ran perfectly on my Linux system.

Played with Manjaro Linux (Kernel 5.12.8, Mesa 21.1.2) on an AMD Ryzen 1700 @ 4GHz, an AMD RX 5700 XT and 16GB RAM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239922912', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 357, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1633571262}
review:
I was a little bit disappointed in this second chapter of the game, because there was not as much Reggae music in the soundtrack, it was mostly Jazz style in my opinion. Also there was way less comedy in this chapter, which is understandable if you think of the story, but it was still a disappointment. Still, I think this chapter was great and the story seems to just get better!

Thanks again to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Tchiike/]ğ’¯ğ’¸ğ’½ğ’¾ğ’¾[/url] for this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069877806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1631617768}
review:
Okay, the second chapter was better in term of length (still think it should have been made into a single game - or making the first chapter a free to play or very cheap intro and making chapter 2 and 3 a single game)
the story is still quite simple missing any major twists, but the puzzles are well-planned across the area (the computer part was a bit clumsy, tho).
The music was good but the volume of different pieces varied making it annoyingly loud at times. Similarily, the voice acting - Bwana was mostly quiet while some characters like the gangsters boomed making it unpleasant to hear together in a dialogue. Apart from that the characters sounded original and fresh.
For a point and click i give it 7/10. On to chapter three.

review:
La storia fa un passo in piÃ¹ rispetto al primo capitolo e si fa piÃ¹ coinvolgente. Sempre belle le scene e l'atmosfera noire.
Trovo che gli enigmi siano ancora troppo semplici e suggeriti.
Nel complesso Ã¨ migliorato, diventa interessante scoprire cosa accadrÃ  nel terzo e ultimo capitolo.

review:
A dramatic improvement over the previous installment! The plot actually progresses, there is a good amount of variety to the environments and soundtrack, the characterization is much better, the puzzles make significantly more sense...

Chapter one is not a good game but it is required to fully appreciate this game, so keep that in mind. This game is above average for adventure games despite its short runtime. Not significantly above average, mind you. But worth experiencing.

review: A good continuation from the first game, TJD: Chapter 2 continues the great style of this series. The aesthetic and music continue to be grand, the puzzles are a bit more complicated but still far from impossible and everything just feels a bit "bigger", if that makes sense. The story also develops nicely and I, for one, am excited to finish it off with the third chapter! If you liked the first game and are a fan of Point n Click games, you should play this as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004883087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1612021371}
review: A marked improvement from the first one. The moon logic is reined in a bit, the graphics look better, the lines sound good, the comedy is tuned down but still there. The story starts to pick up a lot compared to the first one. The lore seems interesting and characters seem more natural in this one. Don't worry about skipping the first game. They catch you up from it's events at the beginning (just be sure to talk to Lina at the beginning). This game is easy to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049823783', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1583467370}
review:
Resumen de los capitulos 2 y 3

Capitulo 2
terminan en un barco luego de caer al oceano y finalmente terminan presos - se escapan y estan en la ciudad, te encontras con la secretaria del capo mafioso e intentan descifrar quien era el padre del protagonista y exponer el entramado corrupto del mafioso, recuperas tu nave y te las arreglas para robar un libro (que tiene registros importantes) pero no entendi si son del mafioso o de una mujer mafiosa (se vuelve confusa la trama), cuestion que huis en tu avion hasta una especie de isla (eso parece) y ordenan seguirte en una nave similar al Albatross de Robur.
Descubrimos una tierra "legendaria" y da comienzo al capitulo 3.

Capitulo 3

Despues de haber ingresado a la cueva y descubierto unos hongos que pudieron usar como globo aerostatico, encuentran al elevarse que Armando el mafioso monto una compaÃ±ia extractivista en la isla y son derribados por ametralladoras, investigan un poco mas en la isla y ven que estan minando unos cristales, luego se dirigen hacia una ciudad cercana yendose en el transporte que tienen, en la ciudad intentan con la mujer y otras personas armar una especie de grupo revolucionario y de acabar con los planes malvados de la Mujer del albatross (que creo es la jefa de Armando), finalmente otro tipo malo de pelo largo (que no se bien que vinculos tiene que armando por que se que es otro mafioso) asesina en vivo a una alcaldesa y es filmado y deschavetado (Por los personajes principales, antes usabamos a la chica un rato) y supuestamente todo termina, sale gente y medios de prensa y festejan (no se entiende que).

Analisis sobre aspectos del juego:

Quiero dejar en claro que me gusta muchisimo la parte grafica, visual, estetica, de musica, ambientacion, sonidos, no tanto la jugabilidad (que no innova en nada) y como camina el personaje (que es lento).

no obstante el lore es realmente malo, y los capitulos 2 y 3 sencillamente cae barranca abajo y no se entiende absolutamente nada. Puzzles nada intuitivos, Historia que progresa Lentamente, con muchos desvios, no profundiza en nada, personajes que pasan y nos olvidamos que hacian o que conexion tienen, no hay flashbacks, nada.

Es una pena, Empezo moderadamente bien el capitulo 1 (con fallas) pero que no se corrigieron, sino que empeoraron tanto en el 2 y mucho mas en el 3.

Es una lastima por que hay otros aspectos MUY bien cuidados del juego, pero como es una AVENTURA Point & click, no puedo recomendarla si el Lore falla.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198142054178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1609849853}
review: I had a bit more fun with this chapter. There was more time to develop the story, more cutscenes and a slightly longer game in general. I didn't like the final puzzle (I just don't like that type of puzzle), but I'm sure there are hardcore og adventure game fans out there who loved it. The final shot of the game was a bit underwhelming for all the buildup. I am def playing the final chapter, though. There are a couple plot threads I feel really invested in. I hope they pay off.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998543056', 'num_games_owned': 2352, 'num_reviews': 637, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1695691869}
review:
"Journey Down: Chapter Two" continues the delightful adventure of Bwana and Kito in the vibrant world of St. Armando. Building upon the charm and humor of the first chapter, this installment takes players deeper into the mysteries and wonders of this Caribbean-inspired universe.

The second chapter offers an engaging continuation of the story, introducing new characters and locations that add layers of intrigue to the narrative. The humor remains a strong suit, with witty dialogues and amusing interactions that keep you entertained throughout your journey.

Just like in the first chapter, the art style is a visual feast, with hand-painted backgrounds that transport you to a world bursting with color and personality. The attention to detail in the environment and character designs adds depth to the overall experience.

Gameplay remains true to the point-and-click adventure genre, with well-crafted puzzles that challenge your problem-solving skills without becoming overly frustrating. The intuitive interface ensures a smooth and enjoyable experience, allowing you to immerse yourself in the game's rich and charming world.

The voice acting continues to shine, with the characters' voices bringing depth and authenticity to their personalities. Bwana and Kito's endearing camaraderie remains a highlight, and their interactions with the eccentric inhabitants of St. Armando add a layer of warmth to the story.

"Journey Down: Chapter Two" is a delightful continuation of this episodic adventure series. It successfully maintains the charm and humor of the first chapter while deepening the story and expanding the world of St. Armando. If you enjoyed the first chapter, you'll find this installment to be a worthy addition to the series, and if you're new to Bwana and Kito's adventures, it's a great time to jump into this colorful and entertaining journey.

review:
Je vais faire une Ã©valuation gÃ©nÃ©rale pour les trois chapitres, parce que de mon point de vue c'est un package qui n'est pas sÃ©parable malgrÃ© certaines diffÃ©rences de qualitÃ© entre les chapitres.

De maniÃ¨re gÃ©nÃ©rale, j'ai trouvÃ© que ce jeu Ã©tait trÃ¨s agrÃ©able et valait d'Ãªtre essayÃ© parce qu'il y a clairement un taf Ã©norme qui a Ã©tÃ© fourni et que l'immersion est trÃ¨s rÃ©ussie. En gros, musicalement et esthÃ©tiquement parlant je suis fan, le scÃ©nar tient la route, les dialogues sont au top et les doublages aussi... ce qui pÃ¨che, c'est la partie jeu.

La musique est excellente (surtout dans les deux premiers chapitres, mais le troisiÃ¨me ne dÃ©mÃ©rite pas pour autant, c'est juste plus rock et je suis pas archi fan du rock cuivrÃ©). C'est un jeu qui gagne Ã  Ãªtre Ã©coutÃ© au casque ou avec de bonnes enceintes.

L'univers et les personnages sont juste splendides, le travail sur les masques africains est gÃ©nial, il y a beaucoup d'ambiances diffÃ©rentes toutes hyper rÃ©ussies je trouve. Il y a de la cohÃ©rence entre les thÃ¨mes sonores et visuels, bref de ces deux points de vue c'est une rÃ©ussite totale je trouve.

Le scÃ©nar est bien cool, rien de rÃ©volutionnaire, mais il y a un peu de lecture plus ou moins facultative que j'ai beaucoup apprÃ©ciÃ©, il y a eu un vrai effort pour construire un monde Ã  dÃ©couvrir et c'est rÃ©ussi. L'histoire en elle-mÃªme est intÃ©ressante, trÃ¨s inspirÃ©e dessin animÃ© pour (grand) enfant au final, je verrais bien une adaptation en long mÃ©trage (mais Ã§a se ressent pas trop sur le moment).

Les dialogues eux sont juste parfaits, et qui plus est doublÃ©s Ã  la perfection. Le langage colle aux personnages, c'est haut en couleur, drÃ´le sans verser dans le comique pour le comique, bref au niveau de la musique et des dessins, c'est Ã  dire au top.

Bon tout Ã§a est donc super, surtout pour un point and click, mais il y a un mais. Dans les deux premiers chapitres, certaines des opÃ©rations Ã  faire ne sont vraiment pas intuitive. C'est Ã  dire que la difficultÃ© de l'Ã©nigme ne vient pas de trouver ce qu'il faut faire mais par quelle action le faire. Et Ã§a j'avoue Ã§a m'a un peu frustrÃ©, notamment dans le chapitre 2 ou j'ai passÃ© des heures bloquÃ©, j'ai recommencÃ© le jeu et tout en me disant que j'avais peut Ãªtre ratÃ© un truc, tout Ã§a parce que l'action Ã  faire pour se dÃ©bloquer est juste mal foutue et aurait mÃ©ritÃ© plusieurs entrÃ©es possibles (je peux pas en dire plus sans spoil). Ceci dit rien d'insurmontable, juste assez pÃ©nible, et je pense qu'il y a eu une certaines prise de conscience du problÃ¨me parce que dans le chapitre 3, je ne l'ai pas rencontrÃ©. Seulement Ã§a c'est fait aux dÃ©pends de la difficultÃ© du chapitre qui est bien plus faible que pour le second.

AprÃ¨s pour revenir dans le positif, les moyens de rÃ©solution des problÃ¨mes sont trÃ¨s drÃ´les et bien imaginÃ©s, ils renforcent parfaitement l'univers que les dÃ©veloppeurs ont construit. Et certaines Ã©nigmes sont quand mÃªme assez dÃ©concertantes (dans le bon sens du terme).

A noter que le chapitre 1 est trÃ¨s court, mais c'est une intro en quelque sorte, les deux autres sont bien plus complets. Petite prÃ©fÃ©rence au second pour ma part mais je pense que c'est subjectif.

Bref The Journey Down est Ã  mon sens un bon point and click, auquel il faut jouer pour son ambiance, mais qui peut pÃ©cher par sa jouabilitÃ© et un petit manque de difficultÃ©.

author: {'steamid': '76561199056799889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1603646860}
review: Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198164016063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1603395999}
review:
pros

+ great looking and detailed hand drawn background artwork
+ story is fine
+ jazzy soundtrack
+ noir atmosphere
+ witty cartoony characters
+ well made cartoony cut scenes
+ good voice acting
+ easy to use point and click interface
+ puzzles mostly enjoyable and easy.
+ game drops cards

cons

- lack of a button which shows hotspots
- some trial and error puzzles
- game is short and episodic
- puzzles not overly complicating but generally you don't know what to do next. a hint system would be useful.
- there are no steam achievements

author: {'steamid': '76561198094017370', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1602604729}
review:
Das zweite Kapitel einer empfehlenswerten Trillogie klassischer Adventures in einem auÃŸergewÃ¶hnlichen Setting.
Dieses Kapitel ist lÃ¤nger als die anderen beiden, besitzt umfangreichere RÃ¤tsel und eine sehr umfangreiche Haupt-Location.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1602786358}
review:
(Played on linux/Nouveau)

Second episode of a point n' click 3-parter.
Even better than its predecessor.

Good art, music, story, characters, puzzles and humour.
Plus, quick scene transition (on double-click) has been added to the interface.

This title instantly put me in a good mood every time I launched it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046060461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1602393291}
review:
Better than the first game, in terms of atmosphere, music, and gameplay. The puzzles were a bit harder, but still on the easy side. I did have to use a guide a couple times because there were two areas I didn't know I could access (there are a few places where the arrows either look the same as arrows to other locations or only appear in a small area of the screen). Also at one point you have to type something into a computer and while there are many keywords which would be reasonable, only one works.

Once again, the only problem was length. 3h of gameplay was great value for $1.99. Not so much for $20.

O jogo tem pouco mais de 4 horas (contra 2 horas do primeiro) e flui bem. A dificuldade Ã© normal, mesmo os puzzles mais obscuros podem ser resolvidos com lÃ³gica e/ou um pouco de tentativa-e-erro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043379091', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1597872997}
review: veri dificul

author: {'steamid': '76561198124627976', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1597153382}
review: Amazing continuation of the first chapter with even more phenomenal music and artwork. This game is pure fun with some good puzzles along the way. Recommend to anyone who enjoyed the first chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144593917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1593465411}
review: I think chapter two is the strongest entry in the Journey Down series. It has the same strengths as chapter one (great music, interesting aesthetic, intriguing and mysterious story, good puzzles), and it is much longer and more satisfying than chapter one, which was practically just a quick demo. This isn't one of the best point and click games I've ever played or anything like that, but it's very solid, and I had a good time playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198365813071', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1597160758}
review: ya mon

author: {'steamid': '76561198022508238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1595434944}
review: So far so good:) In the second chapter of the Journey Down, we get another portion of the story, but otherwise it just more of the same... i.e. more of the same fun game:) The second chapter seems a bit longer than the first one, but you can still finish it in an evening, which is just about the right length for this kind of stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004894190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1595060147}
review:
Really good! And a big improvement and expansion of Chapter one. This chapter was at least twice as long, probably 8-10 hours. I got stuck twice each for an hour, and had another hour of idle pc time. It was more difficult than Chapter 1, and it didn't hold your hand as much. Chapter 1, in retrospect seems almost like a tutorial compared to Chapter 2.

The only con is, just like Chapter 1, it suffers from audio issues. For whatever reason, some dialogue is at a very low volume compared to the majority of the dialogue. Also, you definitely need to turn the music down in the settings by at least 50% or else it drowns out the dialogue. It's a minor issue considering how enjoyable the game is overall, but I wish they would do an update where they fix the audio. It seems like it would be an easy fix, but I'm not a game developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144207509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1593539485}
review:
So mag ich Point & Click Adventure. Lustige Charaktere, bunte vielfÃ¤ltige Orte, nicht zu schwere Puzzel und logisches Vorankommen. Die Charaktere sind sehr gut vertont und gibt ein paar witzige Dialoge. Der Soundtrack macht gute Stimmung und sogar die kurzen Zwischensequenzen find ich gut gemacht. Erinnern irgendwie an alte Tomb Raider Zwischensequenzen :) 
Jetzt noch Teil 3, aber 1 & 2 fand ich schon mal sehr gut!

Ğ’ÑĞµ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°ÑˆĞ»Ğ¾: Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ - Ñ‚Ñ€ÑƒĞ´Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾ÑĞ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ, Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ğ´Ñ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²ÑƒÑ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒ, Ğ·Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ´ĞºĞ¸ - Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ, ÑĞ¾Ğ²Ğ¼ĞµÑ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ 3Ğ´ Ğ¸ 2Ğ´ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ³Ğ»ÑĞ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ ÑƒĞ¶Ğ°ÑĞ½Ğ¾, Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞ¼ĞµÑˆĞ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞµĞ¹ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ´Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024707408', 'num_games_owned': 2339, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1592651007}
review: The Journey Down: Chapter Two is a bigger and better game than its predecessor - makes the excellent Chapter 1 really feel like the prologue to the adventure itself. This game has pretty much the same characteristics as the first one, only more. For me, the puzzles shine in this installment as they are more clever and elaborate, but never obtuse. Bwana and Kito are as likable as ever, and I notice that the developer likes to make supporting characters generally pleasant towards the protagonist (except for the villains, obviously). To give an example, there are some shady characters in the alley but when Bwana interacts with them, they are more or less amiable towards him. This kind of pleasant atmosphere in a dark dystopia is one of the things that make this series unique and great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068817861', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1589234259}
review:
tl;dr Even better than the first chapter; brings a lot of Noir into the otherwise rustic-Jamaican story.

The Journey Down Chapter Two sees us arriving at a noir-ish town where the Mafia has its rule over everything and everyone, gangsters roam the streets, and unsophisticatedly bribable people are in charge of the law. 

The drastic change of ambience bring about a sudden shift in the overall experience while playing: you're no longer a clueless young, happy-go-round Jamaican boy; you're now a man on a mission. You have people to protect and a message to send out. 

Although this is true, there is no change in the number of absurdities which add a pinch of irony and sarcasm to every single task. Thanks to our hero, Bwana - everything is just as funny as flying with a plane without watching... you're afraid of heights, right?

In this portion of the story, we encounter several side-characters which reenforce the plot and add substance to the beginning we had thrown at us in the first chapter. Practically, some of the best character development I've seen in recent games - within a 4-hour timeframe!

The music is still as great, adjusting its genres to suit the new environment and the more suspenseful part of Bwana and Kito's story. Ambience noise and voiceover are quirky, but they are oh-so ideal to this game. 

Loved the extras and the credits given at the end of each game.

This is chapter 2 out of 3 of the story. It's not a standalone game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968838120', 'num_games_owned': 9661, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1587696850}
review: The only negative thing to say about this great adventure game is that there's no reason anymore to have it as three separate games on Steam.  May as well play all three, which would amount to a rather long adventure rather than three short-ish episodes priced separately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120481927', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1586718803}
review: The best of both worlds when comparing all Three Chapters of The Journey Down. I found throughout my playthrough of Chapter Two I would genuinely laugh at some of the jokes/ridiculousness of some of the situations the developers through the player into. This was one of the better things that came along with The Journey Down Chapter One. The other high point of this Chapter appears when comparing to Chapter Three, the amount of character/story/world development makes the trilogy a true joy to play through. Some of the puzzles within this chapter can be a real challenge but as long as you have a bit of experience with how absurd some Point and Click games can be you should have no issues solving them with a bit of trail and error. The Journey Down Chapter Two is a 8.5/10, Highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198079462590', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1584845521}
review:
After playing the first chapter, I thought to myself, "Wow, that was pretty good. Short and simple, but pretty good. I hope the next chapter won't just be a copy of this one though. That would just be disappointing."

After playing Chapter 2, I can say with absolute certainty that I was NOT disappointed!

I'll be frank: Chapter 1 didn't deserve the comparisons to Grim Fandango that the art style gave it. It was good, but not THAT good. Chapter 2, though? It could almost give Grim Fandango a run for its money! More excellent music, with even better story and puzzles, and a setting that changes as you progress the story as well! Honestly, this one might be my favorite out of the three!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024817259', 'num_games_owned': 2013, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1578809961}
review:
My recommendation comes with the caveat of getting the entire trilogy deeply discounted. For the asking price, there isn't nearly enough content.

Excellent soundtrack, voice acting, art, animation, and story. I laughed out loud multiple times. Such a shame that there's not nearly enough of it. I spent 16 hours on the entire trilogy without using guides. For the asking price of $40 for the trilogy, that's insanely expensive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042757315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1578807487}
review:
Pros:
+Bwana's voice.
+Some nice jazz music all throughout.
+A pair snarky dockworkers with some snappy dialog.
+The most fabulous taxi driver I've ever seen.
+Some mildly satisfying puzzles.
+Bwana can show random items to various characters to get some funny banter.
+Bwana's voice!

Cons:
-Not enough Kitto.
-Many environments literally look like concept art. Makes the 3D characters awkward stand out.
-Some puzzles were too easy, with too little pieces and solutions too easy to find.
-The world is very strange and makes no sense.
-Some characters masks (they are based off african masks) are nightmare fuel. Bwana's gets a pass cuz of his cool voice man.
-Story is muddy. Bad guys want book. They did bad stuff in the past. We look into it. We steal book from bad guys. And that's all that I remember that matters.
-With all the callbacks to past events, it would have been nice to have flashbacks (in old filmgrain style)

Worth it just for more of Bwana's voice mon! :)

review: I got about double the amount of game time on chapter 2 versus chapter 1.  It didn't really matter since I found them both dirt cheap on sale.  See my review on chapter 1 for how I feel about this franchise so far.  Everything about 1 still applies to 2.  In fact, the two games would have been seamless if they'd released them as one.  Don't have anything new to add here really that I didn't say already, other than a reminder to future me, that I did finish and enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198807258328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1566721486}
review:
Korean user who came upon this series while searching for point-and-click adventure games. These types of games were my childhood, so every so often I will Google for new releases. The Journey Down being 1. afro inspired and 2. looking the way it does (very reminiscent of Grim Fandango) immediately convinced me to purchase.

[h1] PROS [/h1]
These are just like the point-and-click adventures of old! I appreciate its focus on family, friendship, mystery, and adventure rather than, say, romance. The plot, while sluggish, is suspenseful at points and more gripping as the game progresses. The soundtrack is incredible. Most of the puzzles make intuitive sense. The main characters (Bwana, Kito) are the most likable duo I have met in fiction. Gorgeous, gorgeous aesthetic.

[h1] CONS [/h1]
Chapter 1 was short and felt confined, as you were limited to one setting for 99.5% of the game. Chapter 2 had a message and hammered it in with every line of NPC dialogue they could fit in. The characters are wordy, which you appreciate on your first playthrough but will likely find yourself checking out of in replays. The graphics look outdated, but this adds to the nostalgic feel of the old adventure games. Some lines of dialogue that you have exhausted do not disappear and you will often find yourself having repeat conversations. There was much world building potential with the phone booth and computer, which was not fully explored. Needs more save slots (the game only has 3) with the ability to add titles.

But no game is perfect and, overall, I highly recommend Chapter Two. 8.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065147780', 'num_games_owned': 1566, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1563928028}
review:
Para quien no quiera leer el anÃ¡lisis completo dejo un resumen con pros y contras al final de Ã©l

[h1]VOLVIENDO A LOS VIEJOS TIEMPOS: 2a PARTE[/h1]

[b]Historia[/b]: The Journey Down 2, es la segunda parte de una trilogÃ­a (la cual ya ha salido completa), de una aventura grÃ¡fica con ambientaciÃ³n caribeÃ±a (con nombres ficticios eso sÃ­) y que bebe de los clÃ¡sicos como los primeros Monkey Island (sÃ­, tambiÃ©n tiene chistes graciosos jeje). Bwana, el protagonista, llega a Port Artue con su hermano Kito y su amiga Lina, siguiÃ©ndole la pista a su padre y a un misterio en el que el se viÃ³ involucrado...AsÃ­ empieza The Journey Down 2, donde la bÃºsqueda de su padre se complica por momentos, habiendo mucho mÃ¡s trasfondo del que inicialmente parecÃ­a.

[b]Jugabilidad[/b]: Estamos ante una aventura grÃ¡fica Point & Click de corte clÃ¡sico, en la que sÃ³lo necesitarÃ¡s el ratÃ³n para jugar. El movimiento y la transiciÃ³n entre escenarios es bastante fluida, asÃ­ como la respuesta a la hora de interactuar con los objetos y puntos de interÃ©s. 

Respecto a la [b]duraciÃ³n[/b], han sido algo menos de [b]3 horas[/b], sin guÃ­a, realmente no te va a hacer falta. Es lo que tiene ser una parte de una trilogÃ­a.

Respecto a la dificultad, apenas hay, tampoco es que sea excesivamente fÃ¡cil porque hay varias cosas que resolver, pero raro serÃ¡ el perderse, y en caso de hacerlo, revisa bien los escenarios que posiblemente se te ha pasado algÃºn objeto o escenario (a mi me pasÃ³ un par de veces). Eso sÃ­ tambiÃ©n verÃ¡s cada puzzle sumamente obvio que pensarÃ¡s porque no se lo trabajaron un poco mÃ¡s. Por cierto, estÃ¡ en inglÃ©s, aunque no requiere un gran nivel para entenderlo y existe un traducciÃ³n al castellano en las guÃ­as de la comunidad de steam bastante bien hecha.

[b]GrÃ¡ficos[/b]: Mezcla entre hechos a mano con digitalizaciÃ³n de los dibujos que ha quedado bastante bien. QuizÃ¡s los escenarios se presenten algo oscuros, de hecho la historia se desarrolla entre nieblas y la noche. Los personajes estÃ¡n basados en mÃ¡scaras africanas de diferentes paÃ­ses, con lo que todos los importante son diferentes fÃ­sicamente (y en personalidad).

[b]Sonido[/b]: Excelente ambientaciÃ³n para la historia. Jazz junto a ritmos de los aÃ±os 20 dan lugar a una banda sonora que acompaÃ±a durante todo el juego, y que no te cansaras de oir. TODOS los personajes estÃ¡n DOBLADOS (en inglÃ©s) y cada voz encaja a la perfecciÃ³n con el que le corresponde.

[b]En resumen[/b], The Journey Down 2, es el segundp episodio de una trilogÃ­a de una aventura grÃ¡fica de ambientaciÃ³n afrocaribeÃ±a que bebe de los clÃ¡sicos, y que a los mÃ¡s nostÃ¡lgicos, asÃ­ como a las personas que le gusten este gÃ©nero les encantarÃ¡. De hecho, posiblemente te quedarÃ¡s con ganas de jugar el siguiente capÃ­tulo.

[h1]PROS[/h1]
+La sencillez a la hora de jugarlo y lo fluido que funciona
+La ambientaciÃ³n (mÃºsica y doblaje) es genial
+Raro es que te pierdas, aunque te mantendrÃ¡ entretenido hasta el final

[h1]CONTRAS[/h1]
-La duraciÃ³n, quizÃ¡s podrÃ­an haberlo hecho algo mÃ¡s largo
-Algunos puzzles son demasiado fÃ¡ciles
-El final, te deja con ganas de jugar el siguiente capÃ­tulo

Logros: No
Cromos: SÃ­

[b]NOTA[/b]:9 (por la duraciÃ³n y dificultad). Aventura grÃ¡fica oldschool con aires caribeÃ±os que te mantendrÃ¡ enganchado de principio a fin. Si te gusta el gÃ©nero es tu juego, si no y quieres adentrarte en el mundo de las avenutras grÃ¡ficas, tambiÃ©n. Es digna secuela del primero, aunque lo he visto un pelÃ­n fÃ¡cil demÃ¡s en algunos puntos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020080540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1560722475}
review: Builds on the lovely first game in satisfying ways. We get more amazing music, a larger picture of The Journey Down's intriguing world, and more comedic point-and-click hijinks with Bwana, Kito, and Lina.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027488803', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1559574624}
review:
[h1][b] An afro-noir point & click adventure saga. Chapter Two [/b][/h1]

[i] Do you remember adventure game with strange African-ritual-masks-like faces of heroes? Oh, yeah. It was very similar to [/i] [b] Grim Fandango[/b]. [i] But present-day. [/i] [b] Journey Down[/b]? [i] Yes, it is! [/i]
The Journey Down trilogy is the best choice to involve yourself in point'n'click world. 

Player meet again trio of old characters: [i] Bwana[/i], [i] Kito [/i] and [i] Lina[/i]. They arrived Port-Artue and new line of adventure start. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1776859646
Honestly I don't remember chars from Kingsport Bay streets. Except [i] Mama Makena [/i] of course :D But Chapter Two characters are brighter. [u]My favourites:[/u]
[list]
[*][i] Andiswa [/i] is a calm mayor's secretary. Very useful and nice girl. (Much better than Lina IMO) 
[*][i] Gimbo [/i] is a funny coward fisherman. 
[*][i] Morten [/i] is a lighthouse keeper. The most informed guy in the town.  
[*][i] Mo and Vince [/i] are two ganster-like commercialists. 
[*][i] Ride Reynolds [/i] is very charismatic and confident taxi-driver.
[/list]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1776859680
The Journey Down series have perfect difficulty balance. It's easy enough to keep in mind all information and useful objects.  
New chapter is more exciting gem. It explains some information from first one and expands the lore. Briefly it's an ideal sequel. 
Guess humor style's not for all. It's very straight-forward and little jerk. So stupid and so fun :)

Chapter Two is more epic. Other sides are as good as in the Chapter One. Soundtrack is great! Jamie Salisbury carefully continued unique style of Simon D'Souza.  

[h1][b] If you're a point'n'click fan, don't miss it. Just support this indie game from Sweden. [/b][/h1]

[quote] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198027488803/recommended/220090/ ][b][i] The Journey Down: Chapter One Review [/i][/b][/url] [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993687746', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1559669526}
review:
A very nice, small feelgood adventure. While it has a serious plot, the whole atmosphere is very light-hearted which lightens my mood as well every time. [spoiler]The story has a good, satisfying end as well (looking at you Deponia)[/spoiler]

The graphics aren't the best (who cares about that in a Point 'n Click anyways) and the video sequences aren't either. The puzzles aren't difficult and easily comprehensible, leading to a quick playthrough.

I play the trilogy every now and then, due to the light-heartedness feel of a road movie.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989807190', 'num_games_owned': 2276, 'num_reviews': 599, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1445354733}
review:
The Journey Down is a really cute stylish point and click adventure episodic game with unique Afro-Caribbean vibe and some stylistic influence from Grim Fandango. It's a bit reminiscent of LucasArts games in gameplay too, though with a more simplified interface of just one contextual verb (usually Use or Look at) per mouse click and drag and drop for item usage. It uses the realtime characters with often beautiful pre-rendered backgrounds to create the feel of a CGI movie which works really well in most cases, especially by Chapter Three where art often gets a lot of really amazing (non-interactive) detail.

Chapter Two tries to expand on what Chapter One did quite a bit. It is far longer (possibly the longest chapter of the title), though still will take you under 5 hours. It has a more complicated story progression, more involved puzzles, more characters, far better voice acting and even more detailed art. Unfortunately, it also feels the least fun to play out of all chapters, since it has quite a few moments of complete confusion over what you should or can do next, which, with how many characters, areas and items you get, gets pretty complicated. Additionally, this is the chapter where it becomes rather evident that the plot rushes towards its story bit conclusions often jumping over entire arcs just to get to the point.

Whenever you should check this and last Chapter or not really depends on if you can enjoy Chapter One for what it is, as the game never truly evolves past that. It remains oddly swift in the plot, awkward in writing, but absolutely stunning in terms of music and visuals. I enjoyed playing through this episodic title throughout the years enough, but I'm hard pressed to actually recommend it to anyone, especially now when we have such a wonderful variety of point and click adventures to pick from. That said, I can't simply dismiss the title either, as it's definitely worth at least checking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1556320909}
review:
[code] Hay disponible una traducciÃ³n al espaÃ±ol (EspaÃ±a) [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1724376783][u]AQUÃ[/u][/url][/code]
[code]Puedes ver mÃ¡s reseÃ±as como esta en la mentorÃ­a [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Esta reseÃ±a no contiene spoilers[/h1]

Con la segunda entrega de esta trilogÃ­a, Skygoblin dio una vuelta de tuerca realmente sorprendente a su trilogÃ­a, creando una continuaciÃ³n mucho mÃ¡s ambiciosa, lÃºgubre y genialmente representada.

Particularmente, los juegos â€œpor fascÃ­culosâ€ no me gustan absolutamente nada, aunque en este caso, y otros similares, con empresas indies tan pequeÃ±as lo puedo llegar a soportar.

Un aÃ±o y medio despuÃ©s de la salida del primer capÃ­tulo, los suecos de Skygoblin nos regalaron una aventura que conservaba su esencia al 100% pero donde mejoraba exponencialmente alguna de sus virtudes.

Para empezar, el juego nos saca de dudas nada mÃ¡s comenzar sobre cuÃ¡l ha sido el destino de nuestros protagonistas despuÃ©s de su abrupto final en el primer episodio. Hecho esto, empezamos a descubrir que los entornos del juego poco o nada tienen que ver con lo visto anteriormente.

Ahora todo serÃ¡ mucho mÃ¡s oscuro, mÃ¡s neblinoso y con un ambiente Noir que le siente realmente de maravilla. De hecho, en mi opiniÃ³n, este es el mejor capÃ­tulo de toda la trilogÃ­a.

Tiene una gran variedad de escenarios, todos con un aspecto Noir de los aÃ±os 40-50 realmente sensacional, y unos temas musicales simplemente magistrales.

AdemÃ¡s, el juego tiene el acierto de incluir lore dentro de la aventura a travÃ©s de diferente material, como libros o similares.

Esto es todo un acierto, ya que cuando empezamos la aventura ya no estaremos en la misma ciudad del capÃ­tulo anterior, y mediante esos documentos el juego dota a ese universo de verdadera verosimilitud, entrando en detalles realmente anecdÃ³ticos que hace que todo cobre mucho mÃ¡s sentido y acerque irremediablemente al jugador al mundo recreado.

En lo que respecta a su jugabilidad, el juego sigue siendo exactamente igual a lo visto con anterioridad, y lo que viene siendo habitual a una aventura grÃ¡fica point nâ€™ click de toda la vida. Lo cual es magnÃ­fico.

Como tal, este segundo capÃ­tulo peca de los mismos defectos que su anterior parte. Es corto, de unas 4 horas, y los puzles no son para nada difÃ­ciles.

Sin embargo, como todo estÃ¡ tan bien recreado y es tan diferente a lo visto con anterioridad, lo mÃ¡s probable es que no nos importe demasiado eso y disfrutemos muchÃ­simo con esta nueva entrega.

Al igual que pasÃ³ con su primera parte, esta segunda tampoco saliÃ³ en espaÃ±ol. Sin embargo, si sigues el enlace arriba indicado, podrÃ¡s visitar una guÃ­a donde podrÃ¡s pasar los textos al espaÃ±ol si sigues los pasos que se indican.

En definitiva, si ya jugaste a la primera parte, sin duda no podrÃ¡s resistirte a jugar a esta segunda. Si no jugaste, no tiene mucho sentido empezar por la segunda Â¿no crees? Porque aunque esta segunda mejora con creces la experiencia, sigue los pasos argumentales de la primera y esa algo fundamental para poder entender perfectamente el universo tan raro e increÃ­ble que se crea en esta segunda parte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106512564', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1555084212}
review:
So for this sequel ill just be mainly pointing to my review of part 1.  To Recap:

Pros
----------------------------------------------------
-I really think the voice acting is great.  The main characters are really enjoyable and the other characters are well cast.
-Fantastic music.  Unfortunately the main music producer passed away during development but a friend of his worked on finishing and it came out amazing!  Also, just like Part 1 the soundtrack to this game is available separately and all proceeds go to charity, very cool!
-Great graphics
-Fun story
-Funny dialogue/monologue
-Good game "flow".  No moon logic or pixel hunting.

Meh.
----------------------------------------------------
-No lip-syncing.  As the rest of the game is so detailed I don't really mind this.  However given the level of detail in everything else in this game it does stand out somewhat.
-It would be nice if the text changed color depending on who was talking.


Cons
---------------------------------
-The main drawback to this series is its cost.  At $20 regular asking price for Part 2 and about 3.5 hours of game time, its simply expensive for a point & click adventure game.  The quality of the game over all compensates for this, but I still think its what holding this game back from being played by more people.  

Overall its a fun chapter and i think is basically the same quality as the first.  Again, the cost is pretty much the the only negative.  If your a P & C die-hard and can catch it on a sale i say its totally worth checking out!  And if you like the music pick up the soundtrack, all proceeds go to charity!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991018562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1554929571}
review: I finished chapter one recently, and now chapter two, and it remains the same great game. There were some improvements in the visuals, the previous bug I had seen in fullscreen is gone. The same problem with episodic games remains, at the end, you don't really have an ending. If you wish for more details I can refer you to my previous review of chapter one. https://steamcommunity.com/id/xorpt/recommended/220090/

author: {'steamid': '76561198082089402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1708310542}
review: one of the best point and click adventures ive ever been a part of!  this series has been nothing but entertaining and held up to my highest genre expectations. one of my favorite parts of this game is the music. although im a bit disappointed to say i bought ch3 on sale (cause they are well worth the full price) the start menu with the music has already got me hooked. the game is fun, the characters are fun, the story is interesting and begs you to keep going, and thank you for blessing this genre with a gem. huge fan. if you enjoy the genre this is a must play

author: {'steamid': '76561198048983815', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1708617578}
review: You really need to advertise better. I've been waiting for the third one and it came out in 2017...

author: {'steamid': '76561198025872487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1552081046}
review:
Played With: Singleplayer, Mouse & Keyboard; Windows 10

[h1]General Thoughts: [/h1]
-This is a decent sequel to the game, the environment and story keep at a good pace the puzzles feel a bit less tight than in Chapter 1 but overall it remains solid and enjoyable. 

[h1]Pros: [/h1]
Bigger, Longer, Cinematic: The game got a significant upgrade form Chapter 1, there are more areas more cutscenes and poriment characters. The story tries to be a lot more action pack and does a decent job at it. 

[h1]Neutral: [/h1]
-Puzzles: The game is much more linear than Chapter 1, meaning there is one maybe two objectives at a given time however that doesn't stop the game from introducing puzzle elements that will be used a good hour to hour and a half in the future. Leading you to waste time with things that wonâ€™t give you anything. The game also relays a bit more on guessing puzzles where you gotta do different combinations, which the first game made fun of, so it's a bit of a shame. Over all the puzzles feel less cohesive than in Chapter 1 but thatâ€™s not to say they arenâ€™t good. There is a decent amount of logic puzzles and they work great, it's just they could have been tweaked to be presented to player in the same fashion as the story progresses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025087928', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 446, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1475057486}
review: Nifty adventure game, funky setting. Logic in the puzzles is solid enough that won't be looking for any obscure solutions. Kind of need to have played chapter one to understand the general plot of this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119466019', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1548963048}
review:
I received the first game for free a good while back and I only recently just played it. Having been pleasantly surprised by its quality, I soon bought the second part, which is definitely as good as the first one. The story of Bwana, Kito and Lina is continued as they make their way to Port Artue, on their quest to get to the Underland and unravel its mysteries. The art style is still the very charming Caribbean-inspired one we saw in the sequel, and its music is still as outstanding (R.I.P to the composer, Simon D'Souza).
The Journey Down games are definitely terribly underrated and if you're a fan of point-n-clicks, then you should definitely check out these diamonds in the rough!

author: {'steamid': '76561198285156504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1480058651}
review: Interesting puzzles, great art, great story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967597415', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1547100465}
review: This game and the other chapters in it are a little clunky with the controls and the dialog wasn't great but they were all very fun. Continuing what I said about Chapter One, Chapter Two continues the fun. This chapter introduced a few puzzles that were pretty challenging but fun at the same time. The play time of this one is a little longer than the other two chapters and is packed with much more of the story that was alluded to in the first chapter.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198068151412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1545238083}
review:
Super/Bessere Fortsetzung vom ersten Teil. 
Ich finde die Umsetzung dieses Teils ist mehr als gelungen. Es gibt viel mehr zu sehen als im ersten Teil. Es ist um einiges interessanter und tiefgrÃ¼ndiger als im ersten Teil. Die Charaktere werden sehr gut ausgeschmÃ¼ckt und das komplette SpielgefÃ¼hl ist einfach da.
Wie auch im ersten Teil, gibt es zwischendurch mal passagen die echt schwierig sein kÃ¶nnen. SpÃ¤ter hat man aber dann den Dreh raus. 
Was mich an solchen doch recht simpel gehaltenen Spielen immer reizt, sind die Maps bzw. die mit viel Liebe entstandene Kulisse, an der auch hier nicht gespart wurde. 3D-Modellierung und gemalte HintergrÃ¼nde ergÃ¤zen sich gut.
Ich habe aktuell 3.5 Stunden hinter mir, und schÃ¤tze die Gesamtspielzeit auf ca. 4 Stunden. Immerhin schon das doppelte als im vorherigen Teil.
Die Geschichte packt auch weiterhin und wird zunehmend immer interessanter. Die Musik ist auch ein sehr wichtiger Teil, die auch in diesem Teil nicht vernachlÃ¤ssigt wurde. Passend zu allen Passagen gute Musik.
Also klare Empfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1626198494}
review:
Another quality production in The Journey Down series. Outstanding voice acting and music. Very solid point and click puzzles. I believe this is a custom game engine, as the local files just have a couple big binaries. I enjoyed this game on ubuntu linux 18.04, with radeon mesa graphic drivers. I had no technical issues.

I recommend these games, even paying full price, since they did a great job sweeping me into the carefree world of the characters, with excellent narrative writing. The challenges were interesting, with several clever hints to point me in the right direction. I enjoyed solving the puzzles and seeing the associated animations and graphics.

Lot of funny, intelligent lines like this one: "This Rastafarian is too smart for those enforcers of Babylon!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198205895069', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1537099428}
review:

Puntaje: 9 / 10

Pros:
* Historia
* AmbientaciÃ³n (la mÃºsica sobre todo!)
* Cutscenes (no son simples videos sino que el arte destaca mucho)

Contras:

author: {'steamid': '76561198016610531', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1498147601}
review: It's still a really good series, keep playing! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2216, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1534922143}
review:
a Point and Click game with today's methods of game making, the way that Devs like BFG made these types of games paved the way forward for them like never before, making them more than just idle mini games we played, today these are gems that a lot of people want and invest serious time and effort into, and let's face it, if you are a fan of these games they are so worth it.

Very detailed art, a lot of effort went into giving us amazing visuals to enjoy, from the character details to the background and room areas.
The Journey Down is inspired by the Traditional African Masks adding a "creepy factor" to the game.
The game has a very nice story, the entirely structure of how the story telling takes place is stunningly done. The game offers some challenging puzzles which is always nice, no one wants to just run through a game without any sweat or effort.
We have a great soundtrack that accompanies the game really improving it and making it much more enjoyable, last but not least the games theme falls under Afro Caribbean if that makes sense, so you are in for a fun time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1489696329}
review: Nice little point & click adventure game, interesting, detail rich and unique art style and with rasta/   Caribbean theme or something along those lines :) Pretty good but also little short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061492959', 'num_games_owned': 1858, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1532532761}
review:
Wonderful sequel, beautiful soundtrack, characters and plot: it's always hard for a sequel to stand up a pretty nice first chapter but The Journey Down: Chapter Two made it without esitation. Lots of funny moments and one-liners.

Only remark I got was not being able to figure out last riddle on my own; maybe it wasn't so hard for an expert adventurer - which I'm not - but without any hints I just couldn't make it. Remaing puzzles are pretty solid though, no weird improvisation needed, just logic, like it was for Chapter One.

I do recommend whole series to anyone and I'm looking forward on buying and playing Chapter Three myself.
SkyGoblin rocks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1632038901}
review:
Chapter Two des Point & Click, das ich [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198063825413/recommended/220090]hier[/url] ausfÃ¼hrlich beschrieben habe.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1444663035

Da es irgendwie wenig sinnig erscheint, nur Chapter Two zu spielen, schreibe ich hier nur wenig dazu.

Die Geschichte verliert m.E. deutlich an Schwung und Zielgerichtetheit zugungsten typischer P&C-RÃ¤tseln und deren SchauplÃ¤tze.

Die RÃ¤tsel werden nun merklich schwieriger. Es gibt mehr SchauplÃ¤tze, an denen es weitergehen kÃ¶nnte und man muss weitgehend eine bestimmte Reihenfolge finden. Es wird wichtiger, auf die Hinweise in den Dialogen zu achten, um zu wissen, was wer braucht.

Die angekÃ¼ndigte afro-karibische Stimmung geht hier m.E. vÃ¶llig verloren.

FÃ¼r diesen Teil habe ich etwa 4,5h gebraucht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142240214', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 662, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1693398286}
review: Very good seguel to first game! Story continues where first ends so it is best to play that right before to remember all details. Humour is still good and puzzles are interesting. Game works good but soulless eyes is still very weird art style but cool! I hope to play next game soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239989578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1531079457}
review: Another wonderful installment in The Journey Down series, this game picks right back up where chapter 1 left off.  I really enjoyed the first chapter, but I felt like chapter 2 was when this game really hit its stride.  It was much more fun and engaging.  The soundtrack is fantastic and really adds to the atmosphere.  This is probably some of the best music I've heard in an adventure game.  The characters are just as goofy and lovable as they were in chapter 1.  This chapter felt much longer than chapter 1, and I was very glad for that.  I felt like chapter 1 was pretty short.  I really liked this game and am looking forward to playing chapter 3 soon.

Like in its predecessor, funny situations, nice characters and a few animated sequences give this title good atmosphere and interesting puzzle choices.
A must buy if you own the first chapter but can be played stand alone also.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171569614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1520773815}
review:
Just as enjoyable as the first chapter - although fortunately a couple of hours longer! I really enjoy the kind humor and the chill out vibe of the game. I didn't get stuck at all in this game, so for me it's a bit on the easy side of puzzle adventures. But still highly recommendable. 

The music is just spot on, mon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053953472', 'num_games_owned': 1950, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1519053988}
review:
A beautiful Point and Click game, the art style is very unique. Sadly this does mean that lipsync isn't always on point.
Most of the voice acting is pretty good, puzzles make sense. Well... mostly, I still needed a walkthrough for some parts.
Backtracking through various screens gets a bit annoying, other than that if you like Point and Clicks I would recommend both this game and the previous one.

Note: I have not yet played the conclusion to the story in the third game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1519440087}
review: A worthy sequel. Definitely worth buying, though maybe wait for a sale as I think $20 is awefully expensive for a 3 hour game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001300277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1558749907}
review: Chapter 1 and 2 are great, 2 being a bit longer for me and more challenging puzzle wise. Only buy part 3 on sale as it's pretty short and has few puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154299846', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 828, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1517282540}
review: Amazing puzzle adventure. I felt stupid at times, sometime the simpliest details are the answers. LOL. I will say that music, artwork and story are PERFECT and make this game what it is! Enjoy it, I know I am.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135438892', 'num_games_owned': 4732, 'num_reviews': 5177, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1516552460}
review: Very nice game

author: {'steamid': '76561198415205302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1516360626}
review:
I said I was going to play this, and now I have.
A charming game, the style and music is very enjoyable, and the puzzle logic reminds me of Escape from Monkey Island.
Not all the puzzles are easy but most are pleasantly challenging, in a way that makes you go 'DURR of course how silly of me not to think of that', despite the solution often times being rather ridiculous.
All except that last rune puzzle that is.
Still I recommend this game, it is fun and Bwana is a funny guy to follow, in comparison to most 'oh I am so serious and I am a detective and there has been a murder which is very serious' main characters in point and click puzzle games.
Like the PuppetShow series.
Now to wait for chapter 3 to be on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048640355', 'num_games_owned': 1373, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1515861636}
review: Extremely easy puzzles, lame characters, tons of cheesy references to adventure game classics. It was a boring game with tons of deus ex machina story connections.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009593548', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1489741907}
review: Loved it

author: {'steamid': '76561198029837806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1513561648}
review:
Loved it from the begining to the end !
A very fun point & click that will set you on good vibe !
A true work of love from the dev.
Thanks for putting this together after 10 years of work !
Definitely recommend for adventure point & click  game lovers !

Pros :
- great visual art
- nice soundtrack
- good mood
- nice voice acting

Cons :
- Ending could have been a bit better

author: {'steamid': '76561197960642654', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 340, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1498387727}
review: Enjoyed it - funny story, puzzles are good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013288876', 'num_games_owned': 1732, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1512383635}
review: An excellent continuation of the story that I only really have a couple of minor complaints about - I would've liked to have seen more of Port Artue, particularly the butterfly house, and I feel the chapter should've ended during the escape sequence. No problems with the beach portion in and of itself, I just feel that it would've been better placed as the opening prologue for chapter 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106351673', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1511495211}
review: The same exact review i gave 1 minute ago to the 1st chapter. i just finished this chapter and its just all in all great. i love the charaters and again the storyline keeps you dragged in. I will be dreaming about the next chapter until i get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142580607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1642812204}
review: This is one of my favorite games. I love the art, story, and music. Chapter two was even better than chapter one. I'm bad at puzzles, so some of them were difficult for me. But it was a fun and interesting challenge. I definitely recommend this if you're a fan of point and click adventures. It is a very unique game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356244265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1507341645}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027747137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1483373057}

author: {'steamid': '76561198287987394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1463811509}
review: Chapter 1 & 2 was an adventure I'd play again. Memorable characters, great art, story and music. Can't wait to try Chapter 3

author: {'steamid': '76561197993521769', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1509746912}
review:
I liked the first part more since the tasks to do were logical enough to figure out myself. But in this part I had to use guides to be able to proceed and I find that rather frustrating. This second part was otherwise very similar to first one, with creepy looking characters and neutral story.

The game is something you might go trough once then forget about it. The story didn't hit me in any way, but it might work for someone else better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995241415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1492983201}
review: Best chapter of the 3, followed by chapter 1. Chapter 3 is the easiest. Can't wait for chapter 4, The Return? Bwana in Deponia?

author: {'steamid': '76561198051084556', 'num_games_owned': 1241, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1508688081}
review:
A charming adventure full of humor and niceness! The smooth gameplay without stalemates decorated with an easy-going jazz soundtrack make a combination that feels really cozy and keeps you in a good mood for the entire journey.

I certainly recommend getting the entire trilogy, as with the bundle you will get a small discount and get a little over 10-12 hours of gameplay altogether.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992123547', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1535307118}
review:
Hello everybody, End World Gaming here to share an excerpt from my review for The Journey Down: Chapter 2 by SkyGoblin.

The Journey Down Chapter 2 is a point and click adventure game that continues the story of Bwana, Kito and Lina after their airplane crashes into the mist. The game begins with our heroes being rescued by a small eel fishing vessel thatâ€™s been lost at sea. The majority of the game takes place in the city of Port Artue which is only mentioned in Chapter 1.

Port Artue is a place full of corruption. Where the rich spend all their time at Club Temba and the poor (Misters) are left doing the work. Upon arrival in Port Artue theyâ€™re confronted by the police chief, Barlow. Bwana and Kito are arrested and Lina and her book are taken elsewhere.

In this chapter, the game engine has seen an upgrade and it renders Port Artue in beautiful fashion. The city is beautifully detailed and it still utilizes itâ€™s hand drawn 2D/3D mixture to winning effect. The game also features a section with rain effects and the puddles of water shining on the ground are quite impressive. The lighting effects have also seen an upgrade and they really add to the atmosphere in many areas. The cinemaâ€™s lights are the most impressive I felt.

Much like the first game, this game features a superb soundtrack. This time it uses a more jazz oriented theme and it sounds amazing. It fits the city of Port Artue perfectly and it really adds to the atmosphere. There were quite a few really catchy songs in this game, including the main menu theme once it got going.

This chapter is also an hour longer than chapter 1 as well. I clocked in at 4.3 hours to completion. I completed Chapter 1 in 3.3 hours by comparison. The chapter features a large variety of puzzles and theyâ€™re always fun to solve.

Overall, The Journey Down Chapter 2 was a superb continuation to Bwanaâ€™s journey and I canâ€™t recommend it highly enough. The game features a great story, an excellent soundtrack, gorgeous artwork, and a great cast of interesting characters. Itâ€™s a great game all around and it makes me excited to see how Bwanaâ€™s story will end in the final chapter.

If you'd like to see my final score for the game, be sure to visit us here: http://www.endworldgaming.com/adventure/the-journey-down-chapter-2-review

author: {'steamid': '76561197969262668', 'num_games_owned': 1141, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1458399668}
review:
The adventure continues! Chapter 2 really improves over the first game with bigger action, more locations, fun puzzles and a longer play time. A great sequel with even more polish and shine than the first game. The story get's even more interesting as we meet fun new characters and explore larger new locations.

A great sequel to a fun game. If you enjoyed the first game you will love this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193681362', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1507822981}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063459813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1507741246}
review: The game takes a much more serious tone than the first one, about twice as long. it improves on the very few shortcomings the first game have, the story become more and more interesting. Some puzzles are a little too simple, but asides from that they've done a great job, many new characters, beautiful locations, Going to play the third chapter now, hope they made it as well as this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966111497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1507243467}
review: Chapter two is even better than Chapter one. The game feels more polished, higher quality, and the story is great too. I like the noir themed city in the mist, everything wet from constant raining and digny from the grime of a corrupt city. A lot of fun.
